quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Term and Zoology
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, antigens, definition. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which term denotes the classification of organisms, based on their evolutionary descent?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Phylogenetics

questions.question: The culture of physics research differs from the other sciences in the separation of these two.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Theory and experiment

questions.question: The term ethology, which refers to the study of animal behaviour, derives from a Greek word, which means what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Custom

questions.question: The word physics derives from the Greek - φ?σις (phusis), which means this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nature

questions.question: This ancient Greek philosopher, who taught Alexander the Great, wrote a book on zoology entitled History of Animals.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Aristotle

questions.question: What biological term refers to the organs, whose function is considered to have been lost or reduced during evolution?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vestigial organs

questions.question: What is the literal meaning of the word ecology, which derives from Greek?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: study of the household

questions.question: Cryptozoology is a branch of Zoology, which deals with what?

options.text: The animals in the order Acarina - mites and ticks
Animals that are considered to exist but there is no proof for their existence

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Animals that are considered to exist but there is no proof for their existence

questions.question: What is the definition of ontogeny (morphogenesis), one of the branches of developmental biology?

options.text: The study that deals with the relations between predators and their prey
A study that describes the organism from the embryo to adulthood
The relationships of groups of  organisms as reflected by their evolutionary history
The study that deals with the marine mammals

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A study that describes the organism from the embryo to adulthood

questions.question: Laws of physics are properties, common to all material systems.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The formation of toes in salamanders, animals that typically have no such organs, is an example for what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Atavism

questions.question: Pathogenic microorganisms which get into the human body are called antigens because they cause the formation of antibodies. The antibodies are produced by what blood cells?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lymphocites

questions.question: This Swedish botanist and physician, considered one of the fathers of modern ecology, initiated the method of binomial classification.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Carolus Linnaeus

questions.question: What is the definition of the biological term ecotone, which in Greek means a place where ecologies are in tension?

options.text: A transition area between two adjacent ecological communities
A natural unit that consists both of living and nonliving parts, interacting to form a stable system
Separation of groups of organisms as a result of changes in their ecology or in the environment where they live

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A transition area between two adjacent ecological communities

questions.question: One of these major subtopics is not part of classical mechanics.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kinetic theory

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Stars and Scientists
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, stars, discovery. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What celestial formations are considered to be the birthplaces of stars?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nebulae

questions.question: Hypergiants, the largest stars known to scientists, have a mass up to how many times that of the Sun?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 100

questions.question: These two additive primary colors should be combined in order to get the color yellow.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Green and red

questions.question: Which of these most accurately describes the term, Solar System?

options.text: A system of non-stellar objects orbiting a star
A system comprised of a star or group of stars
A system of one or more stars and non-stellar objects, connected in close gravitational association
The planetary system which our Sun along with the nine planets and other non-stellar objects form

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The planetary system which our Sun along with the nine planets and other non-stellar objects form

questions.question: Where can an asteroid belt, a region of greatest concentration of orbiting asteroids, be found nearest to Earth?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Between Mars and Jupiter

questions.question: Plancks constant (h) is equal to this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 6.626068 × 10^(-34) m^2 kg / s

questions.question: Which set contains triangular numbers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1, 3, 6, 10, 15, 21, 28

questions.question: In astronomy, the term binary star refers to which of these?

options.text: A large star which has drawn smaller star to orbit
A star made up from both matter and antimatter
A system of two stars both orbiting around their centers of mass
A star emitting electromagnetic waves at two different frequencies

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A system of two stars both orbiting around their centers of mass

questions.question: Which of these is a celestial body, which produces the effect known as shooting star?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Meteoroid

questions.question: Distances in the universe are enormous compared to those we are used to, so scientists use light years for measurement.  Approximately how many miles does a light year represent?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Six trillion miles

questions.question: In astrophysics, which theorem defines what parameters black holes are characterized by?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Black holes have no hair

questions.question: This is the number of fundamental interactions.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 4

questions.question: Law of Inertia is also referred to as this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Newtons First Law

questions.question: The discovery of cosmic object 2003 UB313 caused much stir in astronomers circles. Its discoverers declared 2003 UB313 to be what?

options.text: The tenth planet in the Solar system
A possible black hole near the edge of the Solar system
A planetary system with signs of intelligent life

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The tenth planet in the Solar system

questions.question: Contrary to this celestial bodys true nature, the term asteroid means what according to its greek origins?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Star-like

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Numbers and Internet
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, kasner, parlance. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: On the Internet, who or what is a server?

options.text: The person who serves the hors doeuvres.
The computer on which the programs of a web site run
The person who serves the customers of an Internet Service Provider
The program which controls a web page

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The computer on which the programs of a web site run

questions.question: In 1938, Edward  Kasner wrote a 1  followed by 100 zeros and showed it to his baby nephew.  What the baby said became the name of that written number. What did the kid say?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Googol

questions.question: Web pages can be viewed on which of these devices?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: ICQ is a type of what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: An instant messaging computer program

questions.question: In Internet parlance, what is a cookie?

options.text: Something stored on the client computer by a web pages program
Something tasty on a web page
Something made up (or cooked) on a web page
A portion of a program governing a web page

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Something stored on the client computer by a web pages program

questions.question: In a list of numbers what, is the mode?

options.text: The number of items in the list
The biggest number minus the smallest number

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The number seen most frequently

questions.question: To find the acceleration of a particle what would we do to the velocity ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Differentiate once

questions.question: The pictures on a web page can be stored in more than one physical location.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which set contains only  prime numbers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2, 3, 5, 7,11,13, 17

questions.question: Johann Regiomontanus first introduced the plus sign, + , in this year.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1456

questions.question: What do mathematicians call any rectangular table of numbers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A matrix

questions.question: The sides of a triangle are 1 inch, 2 inches and 3 inches. What is the perimeter of the triangle.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It has no perimeter

questions.question: Where is the main Internet computer located?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nowhere

questions.question: Calculate 6!
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 720

questions.question: When was the multiplication sign, x, first used?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1631

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Light and Space
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, gravity, http. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the main purpose of pulleys?

options.text: They decrease the force needed to lift something.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They decrease the force needed to lift something.

questions.question: What does WWW stand for?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: World Wide Web

questions.question: Astronauts age faster.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Referred to as the father of integral calculus, he initiated the sciences of hydrostatics, static mechanics and pycnometry (the measurement of the volume or density of an object). He was killed by a Roman soldier who did not know who he was.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Archimedes

questions.question: Who came up with the laws of gravity?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Newton

questions.question: On May 5, 1961, this man became the first U.S. astronaut in space.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alan Shepard

questions.question: These particles form light, as you see it.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Photons

questions.question: The National Aeronautics and Space Administration was established on July 29, 1958 under which U.S.  President?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dwight Eisenhower

questions.question: What is the speed of light in free space?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 186,282 miles per second (~300,000 km/s)

questions.question: In 2001, NASA sent this unmanned spacecraft to orbit Mars in search of signs of water and volcanic activity on the surface.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mars Odyssey

questions.question: This device is used for dispersing light, reflecting it or refracting it.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: prism

questions.question: In the web address http://www.microsoft.com, the com at the end means what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Commercial

questions.question: Internet Explorer, Opera and Mozilla are examples of what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Web browsers

questions.question: Pornography is illegal on the Internet.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: He first developed the principle of relativity.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Galileo

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Planet and Solar System
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, space, gas. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the distinctive feature of the sixth planet of the Solar System (counted from the Sun)?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Its equatorial rings

questions.question: Which is the largest planet in the Solar System?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jupiter

questions.question: The International Space Station is a joint project of five space agencies, including NASA. Which Space Agency is not part of the project?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: China National Space Administration

questions.question: Which of the following Solar System planets are designated as gas planets?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Io and Europa are two of the larger satellites of which Solar System planet?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jupiter

questions.question: Which of the following planets is closest to the Sun?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mercury

questions.question: Which planet has been demoted from its planet status by scientists like Neil Tyson, Director of the Hayden Planetarium?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pluto

questions.question: The mission statement of NASA is to understand and protect our home planet; to explore the Universe and search for life; and to inspire the next generation of explorers.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which planet of the Solar System is nicknamed the Blue Planet?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Earth

questions.question: On January 19, 2006 NASA launched the unmanned mission New Horizons to explore Pluto, on a one-way trip of how many years?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 9

questions.question: Which planet has been described as a sister planet to Earth?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Venus

questions.question: The Vision for Space Exploration is the U. S. space program was announced on January 14, 2004 by President George W. Bush. According to this program, the moon will be explored by manned missions by what year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2020

questions.question: Which planet was named after the ancient Romans’ king of the gods?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jupiter

questions.question: Which planet of the Solar System has been nicknamed The Red Planet?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mars

questions.question: Which planet was named after the Roman god of war?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mars

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Messaging and Instant Messaging Language
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, number, system. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What does NP mean in instant messaging language?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: no problem

questions.question: What does BTDT mean in instant messaging language?

options.text: but I thought you didnt tell

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: been there, done that

questions.question: What does HAND mean in instant messaging language?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: have a nice day

questions.question: What does SYS mean when used in instant messaging ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: see you soon

questions.question: What does POS mean in instant messaging language?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: parent over shoulder

questions.question: What does TIA mean in instant messaging language?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: thanks in advance

questions.question: What does WFM mean when used in instant messaging?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: works for me

questions.question: Most of the land area of Tennessee is in the Eastern time zone.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What does AFK mean in Internet slang?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: away from computer keyboard

questions.question: Which time zone encompasses the least number of the continuous 48 United States?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pacific

questions.question: What does KIT mean in instant messaging language?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: keep in touch

questions.question: Which is the largest of the so-called terrestrial planets of the Solar System?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Earth

questions.question: What does ZZZ mean in Internet slang?

options.text: theres a bee in my house

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: tired or bored

questions.question: Which of the following Solar System planets was not named after a Greek or Roman God?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Earth

questions.question: Which planet of the Solar System is also known as The Evening Star?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Venus
